museums.name: National Museum
museums.description: The National Museum in New Delhi is one of the largest and most comprehensive museums in India. It houses an extensive collection spanning over 5,000 years of cultural heritage, including ancient sculptures, manuscripts, and paintings.

museums.name: National Rail Museum
museums.description: The National Rail Museum showcases the heritage of Indian Railways with exhibits of steam locomotives and historical train artifacts.

museums.name: Shankar's International Dolls Museum
museums.description: This museum houses over 6,500 dolls from 85 countries, showcasing global culture through miniature figures.

museums.name: National Science Centre
museums.description: A leading science museum offering interactive exhibits on various scientific themes and principles.

museums.name: Indira Gandhi Memorial Museum
museums.description: This museum is dedicated to the life of Indira Gandhi and preserves her personal belongings and historical memorabilia.

museums.name: Gandhi Smriti
museums.description: A museum dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi, located at the site where he was assassinated. It offers exhibits on his life and philosophy.

museums.name: National Philatelic Museum
museums.description: This museum houses a vast collection of stamps from India and around the world, showcasing postal history.
